repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Now they make their own tiny cache of the relevant exceptions
at module initialization so they can still access these without
the GIL.

closes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3406

I guess this slightly breaks the contract of the cache_builtins option, that you should be able to monkey-patch builtin stuff (including exceptions). With that said - it's an implementation detail that it's written in Cython. If it was written in C then it'd just use [the standard exception definitions in the headers](https://docs.python.org/3/c-api/exceptions.html#standard-exceptions) and the user wouldn't be able to change them anyway.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1221,7 +1224,7 @@ cdef void *copy_data_to_temp({{memviewslice_name}} *src,
 
     result = malloc(size)
     if not result:
-        _err(MemoryError, NULL)
+        _err(__pyx_memoryview_MemoryError, NULL)

comment_data.body: I actually kept it explicit at the time which options could be set in tests, but wouldn't object to making it dynamic if it gets in the way. Seems better to use `vars()`, though, instead of `dir()` + `getattr()`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -878,7 +878,7 @@ def setUp(self):
         from Cython.Compiler import Options
         self._saved_options = [
             (name, getattr(Options, name))
-            for name in ('warning_errors', 'clear_to_none', 'error_on_unknown_names', 'error_on_uninitialized')
+            for name in dir(Options) if not name.startswith("_")

comment_data.body: Why not just declare `PyExc_IndexError` and friends as external `object`, and use those?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,8 +94,11 @@ cdef extern from "<stdlib.h>":
     void free(void *) nogil
     void *memcpy(void *dest, void *src, size_t n) nogil
 
-
-
+# cache the errors used so access to them doesn't need the GIL
+# with Options.cache_builtins
+cdef __pyx_memoryview_IndexError = IndexError

comment_data.body: Yes but it'd need a `with gil` block
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1221,7 +1224,7 @@ cdef void *copy_data_to_temp({{memviewslice_name}} *src,
 
     result = malloc(size)
     if not result:
-        _err(MemoryError, NULL)
+        _err(__pyx_memoryview_MemoryError, NULL)

comment_data.body: extern `object` isn't allowed but I think this way makes sense so I've declared them as `PyObject*` and added suitable casts inside `_err` and `_err_dim`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,8 +94,11 @@ cdef extern from "<stdlib.h>":
     void free(void *) nogil
     void *memcpy(void *dest, void *src, size_t n) nogil
 
-
-
+# cache the errors used so access to them doesn't need the GIL
+# with Options.cache_builtins
+cdef __pyx_memoryview_IndexError = IndexError

comment_data.body: Adding `cache_builtins` to runtests.py turned out to be a disaster because the contents of the builtins scope isn't reset between tests. I've rolled this back and added a very simple srctree test instead.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -878,7 +878,7 @@ def setUp(self):
         from Cython.Compiler import Options
         self._saved_options = [
             (name, getattr(Options, name))
-            for name in ('warning_errors', 'clear_to_none', 'error_on_unknown_names', 'error_on_uninitialized')
+            for name in dir(Options) if not name.startswith("_")

@@ -94,8 +94,11 @@ cdef extern from "<stdlib.h>":
     void free(void *) nogil
     void *memcpy(void *dest, void *src, size_t n) nogil
 
-
-
+# cache the errors used so access to them doesn't need the GIL
+# with Options.cache_builtins
+cdef __pyx_memoryview_IndexError = IndexError

comment_data.body: No. It looks like I'd stashed it and then forgotten about it. Done now.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,8 +94,11 @@ cdef extern from "<stdlib.h>":
     void free(void *) nogil
     void *memcpy(void *dest, void *src, size_t n) nogil
 
-
-
+# cache the errors used so access to them doesn't need the GIL
+# with Options.cache_builtins
+cdef __pyx_memoryview_IndexError = IndexError

commit.message:
Memoryviews work with cache_builtins=False

Now they make their own tiny cache of the relevant exceptions
at module initialization so they can still access these without
the GIL.

closes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3406
Restored state properly after the tests (but still broken)

Disabled test

It was affecting static state and breaking subsequent tests

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Memoryviews work with cache_builtins=False
